text: Though they hide themselves in the top of Carmel, I will search and take them out there; and though they be hidden from my sight in the bottom of the sea, there I will command the serpent, and it will bite them.

name: Amos 9:4
text: Though they go into captivity before their enemies, there I will command the sword, and it will kill them. I will set my eyes on them for evil, and not for good.

name: Amos 9:5
text: For the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, is he who touches the land and it melts, and all who dwell in it will mourn; and it will rise up wholly like the River, and will sink again, like the River of Egypt.

name: Amos 9:6
text: It is he who builds his rooms in the heavens, and has founded his vault on the earth; he who calls for the waters of the sea, and pours them out on the surface of the earth; Yahweh is his name.

name: Amos 9:7
text: Are you not like the children of the Ethiopians to me, children of Israel?" says Yahweh. "Haven"t I brought up Israel out of the land of Egypt, and the Philistines from Caphtor, and the Syrians from Kir?

name: Amos 9:8
text: Behold, the eyes of the Lord Yahweh are on the sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from off the surface of the earth; except that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob," says Yahweh.

name: Amos 9:9
text: "For, behold, I will command, and I will sift the house of Israel among all the nations, as grain is sifted in a sieve, yet not the least kernel will fall on the earth.

name: Amos 9:10
text: All the sinners of my people will die by the sword, who say, "Evil won"t overtake nor meet us."

name: Amos 9:11
text: In that day I will raise up the tent of David who is fallen, and close up its breaches, and I will raise up its ruins, and I will build it as in the days of old;

name: Amos 9:12
text: that they may possess the remnant of Edom, and all the nations who are called by my name," says Yahweh who does this.

name: Amos 9:13
text: "Behold, the days come," says Yahweh, "that the plowman shall overtake the reaper, and the one treading grapes him who sows seed; and sweet wine will drip from the mountains, and flow from the hills.

name: Amos 9:14
text: I will bring my people Israel back from captivity, and they will rebuild the ruined cities, and inhabit them; and they will plant vineyards, and drink wine from them. They shall also make gardens, and eat their fruit.

name: Amos 9:15
text: I will plant them on their land, and they will no more be plucked up out of their land which I have given them," says Yahweh your God.

name: Obadiah 1:1
text: The vision of Obadiah. This is what the Lord Yahweh says about Edom. We have heard news from Yahweh, and an ambassador is sent among the nations, saying, "Arise, and let"s rise up against her in battle.

name: Obadiah 1:2
text: Behold, I have made you small among the nations. You are greatly despised.

name: Obadiah 1:3
text: The pride of your heart has deceived you, you who dwell in the clefts of the rock, whose habitation is high, who says in his heart, "Who will bring me down to the ground?"

name: Obadiah 1:4
text: Though you mount on high as the eagle, and though your nest is set among the stars, I will bring you down from there," says Yahweh.

name: Obadiah 1:5
text: "If thieves came to you, if robbers by night"oh, what disaster awaits you"wouldn"t they only steal until they had enough? If grape pickers came to you, wouldn"t they leave some gleaning grapes?

name: Obadiah 1:6
text: How Esau will be ransacked! How his hidden treasures are sought out!

name: Obadiah 1:7
text: All the men of your alliance have brought you on your way, even to the border. The men who were at peace with you have deceived you, and prevailed against you. Friends who eat your bread lay a snare under you. There is no understanding in him."

name: Obadiah 1:8
text: "Won"t I in that day," says Yahweh, "destroy the wise men out of Edom, and understanding out of the mountain of Esau?

name: Obadiah 1:9
text: Your mighty men, Teman, will be dismayed, to the end that everyone may be cut off from the mountain of Esau by slaughter.

name: Obadiah 1:10
text: For the violence done to your brother Jacob, shame will cover you, and you will be cut off forever.

name: Obadiah 1:11
text: In the day that you stood on the other side, in the day that strangers carried away his substance, and foreigners entered into his gates, and cast lots for Jerusalem, even you were like one of them.

name: Obadiah 1:12
text: But don"t look down on your brother in the day of his disaster, and don"t rejoice over the children of Judah in the day of their destruction. Don"t speak proudly in the day of distress.

name: Obadiah 1:13
text: Don"t enter into the gate of my people in the day of their calamity. Don"t look down on their affliction in the day of their calamity, neither seize their wealth on the day of their calamity.

name: Obadiah 1:14
text: Don"t stand in the crossroads to cut off those of his who escape. Don"t deliver up those of his who remain in the day of distress.

name: Obadiah 1:15
text: For the day of Yahweh is near all the nations! As you have done, it will be done to you. Your deeds will return upon your own head.

name: Obadiah 1:16
text: For as you have drunk on my holy mountain, so will all the nations drink continually. Yes, they will drink, swallow down, and will be as though they had not been.

name: Obadiah 1:17
text: But in Mount Zion, there will be those who escape, and it will be holy. The house of Jacob will possess their possessions.

name: Obadiah 1:18
text: The house of Jacob will be a fire, the house of Joseph a flame, and the house of Esau for stubble. They will burn among them, and devour them. There will not be any remaining to the house of Esau." Indeed, Yahweh has spoken.

name: Obadiah 1:19
text: Those of the South will possess the mountain of Esau, and those of the lowland, the Philistines. They will possess the field of Ephraim, and the field of Samaria. Benjamin will possess Gilead.

name: Obadiah 1:20
text: The captives of this army of the children of Israel, who are among the Canaanites, will possess even to Zarephath; and the captives of Jerusalem, who are in Sepharad, will possess the cities of the Negev.

name: Obadiah 1:21
text: Saviors will go up on Mount Zion to judge the mountains of Esau, and the kingdom will be Yahweh"s.

name: Jonah 1:1
text: Now the word of Yahweh came to Jonah the son of Amittai, saying,

name: Jonah 1:2
text: "Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city, and preach against it, for their wickedness has come up before me."

name: Jonah 1:3
text: But Jonah rose up to flee to Tarshish from the presence of Yahweh. He went down to Joppa, and found a ship going to Tarshish; so he paid its fare, and went down into it, to go with them to Tarshish from the presence of Yahweh.

name: Jonah 1:4
text: But Yahweh sent out a great wind on the sea, and there was a mighty storm on the sea, so that the ship was likely to break up.

name: Jonah 1:5
text: Then the mariners were afraid, and every man cried to his god. They threw the cargo that was in the ship into the sea to lighten the ship. But Jonah had gone down into the innermost parts of the ship, and he was laying down, and was fast asleep.

name: Jonah 1:6
text: So the shipmaster came to him, and said to him, "What do you mean, sleeper? Arise, call on your God! Maybe your God will notice us, so that we won"t perish."

name: Jonah 1:7
text: They all said to each other, "Come, let us cast lots, that we may know who is responsible for this evil that is on us." So they cast lots, and the lot fell on Jonah.

name: Jonah 1:8
text: Then they asked him, "Tell us, please, for whose cause this evil is on us. What is your occupation? Where do you come from? What is your country? Of what people are you?"

name: Jonah 1:9
text: He said to them, "I am a Hebrew, and I fear Yahweh, the God of heaven, who has made the sea and the dry land."

name: Jonah 1:10
text: Then were the men exceedingly afraid, and said to him, "What is this that you have done?" For the men knew that he was fleeing from the presence of Yahweh, because he had told them.

name: Jonah 1:11
text: Then they said to him, "What shall we do to you, that the sea may be calm to us?" For the sea grew more and more stormy.

name: Jonah 1:12
text: He said to them, "Take me up, and throw me into the sea. Then the sea will be calm for you; for I know that because of me this great storm is on you."

name: Jonah 1:13
text: Nevertheless the men rowed hard to get them back to the land; but they could not, for the sea grew more and more stormy against them.

name: Jonah 1:14
text: Therefore they cried to Yahweh, and said, "We beg you, Yahweh, we beg you, don"t let us die for this man"s life, and don"t lay on us innocent blood; for you, Yahweh, have done as it pleased you."

name: Jonah 1:15
text: So they took up Jonah, and threw him into the sea; and the sea ceased its raging.

name: Jonah 1:16
text: Then the men feared Yahweh exceedingly; and they offered a sacrifice to Yahweh, and made vows.

name: Jonah 1:17
text: Yahweh prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah, and Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.

name: Jonah 2:1
text: Then Jonah prayed to Yahweh, his God, out of the fish"s belly.

name: Jonah 2:2
text: He said, "I called because of my affliction to Yahweh. He answered me. Out of the belly of Sheol I cried. You heard my voice.

name: Jonah 2:3
text: For you threw me into the depths, in the heart of the seas. The flood was all around me. All your waves and your billows passed over me.

name: Jonah 2:4
text: I said, "I have been banished from your sight; yet I will look again toward your holy temple."

name: Jonah 2:5
text: The waters surrounded me, even to the soul. The deep was around me. The weeds were wrapped around my head.

name: Jonah 2:6
text: I went down to the bottoms of the mountains. The earth barred me in forever: yet have you brought up my life from the pit, Yahweh my God.

name: Jonah 2:7
text: "When my soul fainted within me, I remembered Yahweh. My prayer came in to you, into your holy temple.

name: Jonah 2:8
text: Those who regard lying vanities forsake their own mercy.

name: Jonah 2:9
text: But I will sacrifice to you with the voice of thanksgiving. I will pay that which I have vowed. Salvation belongs to Yahweh."

name: Jonah 2:10
text: Yahweh spoke to the fish, and it vomited out Jonah on the dry land.

name: Jonah 3:1
text: The word of Yahweh came to Jonah the second time, saying,

name: Jonah 3:2
text: "Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city, and preach to it the message that I give you."

name: Jonah 3:3
text: So Jonah arose, and went to Nineveh, according to the word of Yahweh. Now Nineveh was an exceedingly great city, three days" journey across.

name: Jonah 3:4
text: Jonah began to enter into the city a day"s journey, and he cried out, and said, "In forty days, Nineveh will be overthrown!"

name: Jonah 3:5
text: The people of Nineveh believed God; and they proclaimed a fast, and put on sackcloth, from their greatest even to their least.

name: Jonah 3:6
text: The news reached the king of Nineveh, and he arose from his throne, and took off his royal robe, covered himself with sackcloth, and sat in ashes.

name: Jonah 3:7
text: He made a proclamation and published through Nineveh by the decree of the king and his nobles, saying, "Let neither man nor animal, herd nor flock, taste anything; let them not feed, nor drink water;

name: Jonah 3:8
text: but let them be covered with sackcloth, both man and animal, and let them cry mightily to God. Yes, let them turn everyone from his evil way, and from the violence that is in his hands.

name: Jonah 3:9
text: Who knows whether God will not turn and relent, and turn away from his fierce anger, so that we might not perish?"

name: Jonah 3:10
text: God saw their works, that they turned from their evil way. God relented of the disaster which he said he would do to them, and he didn"t do it.

name: Jonah 4:1
text: But it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was angry.

name: Jonah 4:2
text: He prayed to Yahweh, and said, "Please, Yahweh, wasn"t this what I said when I was still in my own country? Therefore I hurried to flee to Tarshish, for I knew that you are a gracious God, and merciful, slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness, and you relent of doing harm.

name: Jonah 4:3
text: Therefore now, Yahweh, take, I beg you, my life from me; for it is better for me to die than to live."

name: Jonah 4:4
text: Yahweh said, "Is it right for you to be angry?"

name: Jonah 4:5
text: Then Jonah went out of the city, and sat on the east side of the city, and there made himself a booth, and sat under it in the shade, until he might see what would become of the city.

name: Jonah 4:6
text: Yahweh God prepared a vine, and made it to come up over Jonah, that it might be a shade over his head, to deliver him from his discomfort. So Jonah was exceedingly glad because of the vine.

name: Jonah 4:7
text: But God prepared a worm at dawn the next day, and it chewed on the vine, so that it withered.

name: Jonah 4:8
text: It happened, when the sun arose, that God prepared a sultry east wind; and the sun beat on Jonah"s head, so that he fainted, and requested for himself that he might die, and said, "It is better for me to die than to live."

name: Jonah 4:9
text: God said to Jonah, "Is it right for you to be angry about the vine?" He said, "I am right to be angry, even to death."

name: Jonah 4:10
text: Yahweh said, "You have been concerned for the vine, for which you have not labored, neither made it grow; which came up in a night, and perished in a night.

name: Jonah 4:11
text: Shouldn"t I be concerned for Nineveh, that great city, in which are more than one hundred twenty thousand persons who can"t discern between their right hand and their left hand; and also much livestock?"

name: Micah 1:1
text: The word of Yahweh that came to Micah the Morashtite in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.

name: Micah 1:2
text: Hear, you peoples, all of you. Listen, O earth, and all that is therein: and let the Lord Yahweh be witness against you, the Lord from his holy temple.

name: Micah 1:3
text: For, behold, Yahweh comes forth out of his place, and will come down and tread on the high places of the earth.

name: Micah 1:4
text: The mountains melt under him, and the valleys split apart, like wax before the fire, like waters that are poured down a steep place.

name: Micah 1:5
text: "All this is for the disobedience of Jacob, and for the sins of the house of Israel. What is the disobedience of Jacob? Isn"t it Samaria? And what are the high places of Judah? Aren"t they Jerusalem?

name: Micah 1:6
text: Therefore I will make Samaria like a rubble heap of the field, like places for planting vineyards; and I will pour down its stones into the valley, and I will uncover its foundations.

name: Micah 1:7
text: All her idols will be beaten to pieces, and all her temple gifts will be burned with fire, and all her images I will destroy; for of the hire of a prostitute has she gathered them, and to the hire of a prostitute shall they return."

name: Micah 1:8
text: For this I will lament and wail; I will go stripped and naked; I will howl like the jackals, and moan like the daughters of owls.

name: Micah 1:9
text: For her wounds are incurable; for it has come even to Judah. It reaches to the gate of my people, even to Jerusalem.

name: Micah 1:10
text: Don"t tell it in Gath. Don"t weep at all. At Beth Ophrah I have rolled myself in the dust.

name: Micah 1:11
text: Pass on, inhabitant of Shaphir, in nakedness and shame. The inhabitant of Zaanan won"t come out. The wailing of Beth Ezel will take from you his protection.

name: Micah 1:12
text: For the inhabitant of Maroth waits anxiously for good, because evil has come down from Yahweh to the gate of Jerusalem.

name: Micah 1:13
text: Harness the chariot to the swift steed, inhabitant of Lachish. She was the beginning of sin to the daughter of Zion; For the transgressions of Israel were found in you.

name: Micah 1:14
text: Therefore you will give a parting gift to Moresheth Gath. The houses of Achzib will be a deceitful thing to the kings of Israel.

name: Micah 1:15
text: I will yet bring to you, inhabitant of Mareshah. He who is the glory of Israel will come to Adullam.

name: Micah 1:16
text: Shave your heads, and cut off your hair for the children of your delight. Enlarge your baldness like the vulture; for they have gone into captivity from you!

name: Micah 2:1
text: Woe to those who devise iniquity and work evil on their beds! When the morning is light, they practice it, because it is in the power of their hand.

name: Micah 2:2
text: They covet fields, and seize them; and houses, and take them away: and they oppress a man and his house, even a man and his heritage.

name: Micah 2:3
text: Therefore thus says Yahweh: "Behold, I am planning against these people a disaster, from which you will not remove your necks, neither will you walk haughtily; for it is an evil time.

name: Micah 2:4
text: In that day they will take up a parable against you, and lament with a doleful lamentation, saying, "We are utterly ruined! My people"s possession is divided up. Indeed he takes it from me and assigns our fields to traitors!""

name: Micah 2:5
text: Therefore you will have no one who divides the land by lot in the assembly of Yahweh.

name: Micah 2:6
text: "Don"t prophesy!" They prophesy. "Don"t prophesy about these things. Disgrace won"t overtake us."

name: Micah 2:7
text: Shall it be said, O house of Jacob: "Is the Spirit of Yahweh angry? Are these his doings? Don"t my words do good to him who walks blamelessly?"

name: Micah 2:8
text: But lately my people have risen up as an enemy. You strip the robe and clothing from those who pass by without a care, returning from battle.

name: Micah 2:9
text: You drive the women of my people out from their pleasant houses; from their young children you take away my blessing forever.

name: Micah 2:10
text: Arise, and depart! For this is not your resting place, because of uncleanness that destroys, even with a grievous destruction.

name: Micah 2:11
text: If a man walking in a spirit of falsehood lies: "I will prophesy to you of wine and of strong drink;" he would be the prophet of this people.

name: Micah 2:12
text: I will surely assemble, Jacob, all of you; I will surely gather the remnant of Israel; I will put them together as the sheep of Bozrah, as a flock in the midst of their pasture; they will swarm with people.

name: Micah 2:13
text: He who breaks open the way goes up before them. They break through the gate, and go out. And their king passes on before them, with Yahweh at their head.

name: Micah 3:1
text: I said, "Please listen, you heads of Jacob, and rulers of the house of Israel: Isn"t it for you to know justice?

name: Micah 3:2
text: You who hate the good, and love the evil; who tear off their skin, and their flesh from off their bones;

name: Micah 3:3
text: who also eat the flesh of my people, and flay their skin from off them, and break their bones, and chop them in pieces, as for the pot, and as flesh within the caldron.

name: Micah 3:4
text: Then they will cry to Yahweh, but he will not answer them. Yes, he will hide his face from them at that time, because they made their deeds evil."

name: Micah 3:5
text: Thus says Yahweh concerning the prophets who lead my people astray; for those who feed their teeth, they proclaim, "Peace!" and whoever doesn"t provide for their mouths, they prepare war against him:

name: Micah 3:6
text: "Therefore night is over you, with no vision, and it is dark to you, that you may not divine; and the sun will go down on the prophets, and the day will be black over them.

name: Micah 3:7
text: The seers shall be disappointed, and the diviners confounded. Yes, they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer from God."

name: Micah 3:8
text: But as for me, I am full of power by the Spirit of Yahweh, and of judgment, and of might, to declare to Jacob his disobedience, and to Israel his sin.

name: Micah 3:9
text: Please listen to this, you heads of the house of Jacob, and rulers of the house of Israel, who abhor justice, and pervert all equity.

name: Micah 3:10
text: They build up Zion with blood, and Jerusalem with iniquity.

name: Micah 3:11
text: Her leaders judge for bribes, and her priests teach for a price, and her prophets of it tell fortunes for money: yet they lean on Yahweh, and say, "Isn"t Yahweh in the midst of us? No disaster will come on us."

name: Micah 3:12
text: Therefore Zion for your sake will be plowed like a field, and Jerusalem will become heaps of rubble, and the mountain of the temple like the high places of a forest.

name: Micah 4:1
text: But in the latter days, it will happen that the mountain of Yahweh"s temple will be established on the top of the mountains, and it will be exalted above the hills; and peoples will stream to it.

name: Micah 4:2
text: Many nations will go and say, "Come, and let us go up to the mountain of Yahweh, and to the house of the God of Jacob; and he will teach us of his ways, and we will walk in his paths." For out of Zion will go forth the law, and the word of Yahweh from Jerusalem;

name: Micah 4:3
text: and he will judge between many peoples, and will decide concerning strong nations afar off. They will beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruning hooks. Nation will not lift up sword against nation, neither will they learn war any more.

name: Micah 4:4
text: But they will sit every man under his vine and under his fig tree; and no one will make them afraid: For the mouth of Yahweh of Armies has spoken.

name: Micah 4:5
text: Indeed all the nations may walk in the name of their gods; but we will walk in the name of Yahweh our God forever and ever.

name: Micah 4:6
text: "In that day," says Yahweh, "I will assemble that which is lame, and I will gather that which is driven away, and that which I have afflicted;

name: Micah 4:7
text: and I will make that which was lame a remnant, and that which was cast far off a strong nation: and Yahweh will reign over them on Mount Zion from then on, even forever."

name: Micah 4:8
text: You, tower of the flock, the hill of the daughter of Zion, to you it will come, yes, the former dominion will come, the kingdom of the daughter of Jerusalem.

name: Micah 4:9
text: Now why do you cry out aloud? Is there no king in you? Has your counselor perished, that pains have taken hold of you as of a woman in travail?

name: Micah 4:10
text: Be in pain, and labor to bring forth, daughter of Zion, like a woman in travail; for now you will go forth out of the city, and will dwell in the field, and will come even to Babylon. There you will be rescued. There Yahweh will redeem you from the hand of your enemies.

name: Micah 4:11
text: Now many nations have assembled against you, that say, "Let her be defiled, and let our eye gloat over Zion."

name: Micah 4:12
text: But they don"t know the thoughts of Yahweh, neither do they understand his counsel; for he has gathered them like the sheaves to the threshing floor.

name: Micah 4:13
text: Arise and thresh, daughter of Zion; for I will make your horn iron, and I will make your hoofs brass; and you will beat in pieces many peoples: and I will devote their gain to Yahweh, and their substance to the Lord of the whole earth.

name: Micah 5:1
text: Now you shall gather yourself in troops, daughter of troops. He has laid siege against us. They will strike the judge of Israel with a rod on the cheek.

name: Micah 5:2
text: But you, Bethlehem Ephrathah, being small among the clans of Judah, out of you one will come forth to me that is to be ruler in Israel; whose goings forth are from of old, from everlasting.

name: Micah 5:3
text: Therefore he will abandon them until the time that she who is in labor gives birth. Then the rest of his brothers will return to the children of Israel.

name: Micah 5:4
text: He shall stand, and shall shepherd in the strength of Yahweh, in the majesty of the name of Yahweh his God: and they will live, for then he will be great to the ends of the earth.

name: Micah 5:5
text: He will be our peace when Assyria invades our land, and when he marches through our fortresses, then we will raise against him seven shepherds, and eight leaders of men.

name: Micah 5:6
text: They will rule the land of Assyria with the sword, and the land of Nimrod in its gates. He will deliver us from the Assyrian, when he invades our land, and when he marches within our border.

name: Micah 5:7
text: The remnant of Jacob will be in the midst of many peoples, like dew from Yahweh, like showers on the grass, that don"t wait for man, nor wait for the sons of men.

name: Micah 5:8
text: The remnant of Jacob will be among the nations, in the midst of many peoples, like a lion among the animals of the forest, like a young lion among the flocks of sheep; who, if he goes through, treads down and tears in pieces, and there is no one to deliver.

name: Micah 5:9
text: Let your hand be lifted up above your adversaries, and let all of your enemies be cut off.

name: Micah 5:10
text: "It will happen in that day," says Yahweh, "That I will cut off your horses out of the midst of you, and will destroy your chariots.

name: Micah 5:11
text: I will cut off the cities of your land, and will tear down all your strongholds.

name: Micah 5:12
text: I will destroy witchcraft from your hand; and you shall have no soothsayers.

name: Micah 5:13
text: I will cut off your engraved images and your pillars out of your midst; and you shall no more worship the work of your hands.

name: Micah 5:14
text: I will uproot your Asherim out of your midst; and I will destroy your cities.

name: Micah 5:15
text: I will execute vengeance in anger, and wrath on the nations that didn"t listen."

name: Micah 6:1
text: Listen now to what Yahweh says: "Arise, plead your case before the mountains, and let the hills hear what you have to say.

name: Micah 6:2
text: Hear, you mountains, Yahweh"s controversy, and you enduring foundations of the earth; for Yahweh has a controversy with his people, and he will contend with Israel.

name: Micah 6:3
text: My people, what have I done to you? How have I burdened you? Answer me!

name: Micah 6:4
text: For I brought you up out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed you out of the house of bondage. I sent before you Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.

name: Micah 6:5
text: My people, remember now what Balak king of Moab devised, and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him from Shittim to Gilgal, that you may know the righteous acts of Yahweh."

name: Micah 6:6
text: How shall I come before Yahweh, and bow myself before the exalted God? Shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves a year old?

name: Micah 6:7
text: Will Yahweh be pleased with thousands of rams? With tens of thousands of rivers of oil? Shall I give my firstborn for my disobedience? The fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?

name: Micah 6:8
text: He has shown you, O man, what is good. What does Yahweh require of you, but to act justly, to love mercy, and to walk humbly with your God?

name: Micah 6:9
text: Yahweh"s voice calls to the city, and wisdom sees your name: "Listen to the rod, and he who appointed it.

name: Micah 6:10
text: Are there yet treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked, and a short ephah that is accursed?

name: Micah 6:11
text: Shall I be pure with dishonest scales, and with a bag of deceitful weights?

name: Micah 6:12
text: Her rich men are full of violence, her inhabitants speak lies, and their tongue is deceitful in their speech.

name: Micah 6:13
text: Therefore I also have struck you with a grievous wound. I have made you desolate because of your sins.

name: Micah 6:14
text: You shall eat, but not be satisfied. Your humiliation will be in your midst. You will store up, but not save; and that which you save I will give up to the sword.

name: Micah 6:15
text: You will sow, but won"t reap. You will tread the olives, but won"t anoint yourself with oil; and crush grapes, but won"t drink the wine.

name: Micah 6:16
text: For the statutes of Omri are kept, and all the works of the house of Ahab. You walk in their counsels, that I may make you a ruin, and her inhabitants a hissing; And you will bear the reproach of my people."

name: Micah 7:1
text: Misery is mine! Indeed, I am like one who gathers the summer fruits, as gleanings of the vineyard: There is no cluster of grapes to eat. My soul desires to eat the early fig.

name: Micah 7:2
text: The godly man has perished out of the earth, and there is no one upright among men. They all lie in wait for blood; every man hunts his brother with a net.

name: Micah 7:3
text: Their hands are on that which is evil to do it diligently. The ruler and judge ask for a bribe; and the powerful man dictates the evil desire of his soul. Thus they conspire together.

name: Micah 7:4
text: The best of them is like a brier. The most upright is worse than a thorn hedge. The day of your watchmen, even your visitation, has come; now is the time of their confusion.

name: Micah 7:5
text: Don"t trust in a neighbor. Don"t put confidence in a friend. With the woman lying in your embrace, be careful of the words of your mouth!

name: Micah 7:6
text: For the son dishonors the father, the daughter rises up against her mother, the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law; a man"s enemies are the men of his own house.

name: Micah 7:7
text: But as for me, I will look to Yahweh. I will wait for the God of my salvation. My God will hear me.

name: Micah 7:8
text: Don"t rejoice against me, my enemy. When I fall, I will arise. When I sit in darkness, Yahweh will be a light to me.

name: Micah 7:9
text: I will bear the indignation of Yahweh, because I have sinned against him, until he pleads my case, and executes judgment for me. He will bring me forth to the light. I will see his righteousness.

name: Micah 7:10
text: Then my enemy will see it, and shame will cover her who said to me, where is Yahweh your God? Then my enemy will see me and will cover her shame. Now she will be trodden down like the mire of the streets.

name: Micah 7:11
text: A day to build your walls"In that day, he will extend your boundary.

name: Micah 7:12
text: In that day they will come to you from Assyria and the cities of Egypt, and from Egypt even to the River, and from sea to sea, and mountain to mountain.

name: Micah 7:13
text: Yet the land will be desolate because of those who dwell therein, for the fruit of their doings.

name: Micah 7:14
text: Shepherd your people with your staff, the flock of your heritage, who dwell by themselves in a forest, in the midst of fertile pasture land, let them feed; in Bashan and Gilead, as in the days of old.

name: Micah 7:15
text: "As in the days of your coming forth out of the land of Egypt, I will show them marvelous things."

name: Micah 7:16
text: The nations will see and be ashamed of all their might. They will lay their hand on their mouth. Their ears will be deaf.

name: Micah 7:17
text: They will lick the dust like a serpent. Like crawling things of the earth they shall come trembling out of their dens. They will come with fear to Yahweh our God, and will be afraid because of you.

name: Micah 7:18
text: Who is a God like you, who pardons iniquity, and passes over the disobedience of the remnant of his heritage? He doesn"t retain his anger forever, because he delights in loving kindness.

name: Micah 7:19
text: He will again have compassion on us. He will tread our iniquities under foot; and you will cast all their sins into the depths of the sea.

name: Micah 7:20
text: You will give truth to Jacob, and mercy to Abraham, as you have sworn to our fathers from the days of old.

name: Nahum 1:1
text: An oracle about Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.

name: Nahum 1:2
text: Yahweh is a jealous God and avenges. Yahweh avenges and is full of wrath. Yahweh takes vengeance on his adversaries, and he maintains wrath against his enemies.

name: Nahum 1:3
text: Yahweh is slow to anger, and great in power, and will by no means leave the guilty unpunished. Yahweh has his way in the whirlwind and in the storm, and the clouds are the dust of his feet.

name: Nahum 1:4
text: He rebukes the sea, and makes it dry, and dries up all the rivers. Bashan languishes, and Carmel; and the flower of Lebanon languishes.

name: Nahum 1:5
text: The mountains quake before him, and the hills melt away. The earth trembles at his presence, yes, the world, and all who dwell in it.

name: Nahum 1:6
text: Who can stand before his indignation? Who can endure the fierceness of his anger? His wrath is poured out like fire, and the rocks are broken apart by him.

name: Nahum 1:7
text: Yahweh is good, a stronghold in the day of trouble; and he knows those who take refuge in him.

name: Nahum 1:8
text: But with an overflowing flood, he will make a full end of her place, and will pursue his enemies into darkness.

name: Nahum 1:9
text: What do you plot against Yahweh? He will make a full end. Affliction won"t rise up the second time.

name: Nahum 1:10
text: For entangled like thorns, and drunken as with their drink, they are consumed utterly like dry stubble.

name: Nahum 1:11
text: There is one gone forth out of you, who devises evil against Yahweh, who counsels wickedness.

name: Nahum 1:12
text: Thus says Yahweh: "Though they be in full strength, and likewise many, even so they will be cut down, and he shall pass away. Though I have afflicted you, I will afflict you no more.

name: Nahum 1:13
text: Now will I break his yoke from off you, and will burst your bonds apart."

name: Nahum 1:14
text: Yahweh has commanded concerning you: "No more descendants will bear your name. Out of the house of your gods, will I cut off the engraved image and the molten image. I will make your grave, for you are vile."

name: Nahum 1:15
text: Behold, on the mountains the feet of him who brings good news, who publishes peace! Keep your feasts, Judah! Perform your vows, for the wicked one will no more pass through you. He is utterly cut off.

name: Nahum 2:1
text: He who dashes in pieces has come up against you. Keep the fortress! Watch the way! Strengthen your waist! Fortify your power mightily!

name: Nahum 2:2
text: For Yahweh restores the excellency of Jacob, as the excellency of Israel; for the destroyers have destroyed them, and ruined their vine branches.

name: Nahum 2:3
text: The shield of his mighty men is made red. The valiant men are in scarlet. The chariots flash with steel in the day of his preparation, and the pine spears are brandished.

name: Nahum 2:4
text: The chariots rage in the streets. They rush back and forth in the broad ways. Their appearance is like torches. They run like the lightnings.

name: Nahum 2:5
text: He summons his picked troops. They stumble on their way. They dash to its wall, and the protective shield is put in place.

name: Nahum 2:6
text: The gates of the rivers are opened, and the palace is dissolved.

name: Nahum 2:7
text: It is decreed: she is uncovered, she is carried away; and her handmaids moan as with the voice of doves, beating on their breasts.

name: Nahum 2:8
text: But Nineveh has been from of old like a pool of water, yet they flee away. "Stop! Stop!" they cry, but no one looks back.

name: Nahum 2:9
text: Take the spoil of silver. Take the spoil of gold, for there is no end of the store, the glory of all goodly furniture.

name: Nahum 2:10
text: She is empty, void, and waste. The heart melts, the knees knock together, their bodies and faces have grown pale.

name: Nahum 2:11
text: Where is the den of the lions, and the feeding place of the young lions, where the lion and the lioness walked, the lion"s cubs, and no one made them afraid?

name: Nahum 2:12
text: The lion tore in pieces enough for his cubs, and strangled for his lionesses, and filled his caves with the kill, and his dens with prey.

name: Nahum 2:13
text: "Behold, I am against you," says Yahweh of Armies, "and I will burn her chariots in the smoke, and the sword will devour your young lions; and I will cut off your prey from the earth, and the voice of your messengers will no longer be heard."

name: Nahum 3:1
text: Woe to the bloody city! It is all full of lies and robbery. The prey doesn"t depart.

name: Nahum 3:2
text: The noise of the whip, the noise of the rattling of wheels, prancing horses, and bounding chariots,

name: Nahum 3:3
text: the horseman mounting, and the flashing sword, the glittering spear, and a multitude of slain, and a great heap of corpses, and there is no end of the bodies. They stumble on their bodies,

name: Nahum 3:4
text: because of the multitude of the prostitution of the alluring prostitute, the mistress of witchcraft, who sells nations through her prostitution, and families through her witchcraft.

name: Nahum 3:5
text: "Behold, I am against you," says Yahweh of Armies, "and I will lift your skirts over your face. I will show the nations your nakedness, and the kingdoms your shame.

name: Nahum 3:6
text: I will throw abominable filth on you, and make you vile, and will set you a spectacle.

name: Nahum 3:7
text: It will happen that all those who look at you will flee from you, and say, "Nineveh is laid waste! Who will mourn for her?" Where will I seek comforters for you?"

name: Nahum 3:8
text: Are you better than No-Amon, who was situated among the rivers, who had the waters around her; whose rampart was the sea, and her wall was of the sea?

name: Nahum 3:9
text: Cush and Egypt were her boundless strength. Put and Libya were her helpers.

name: Nahum 3:10
text: Yet was she carried away. She went into captivity. Her young children also were dashed in pieces at the head of all the streets, and they cast lots for her honorable men, and all her great men were bound in chains.

name: Nahum 3:11
text: You also will be drunken. You will be hidden. You also will seek a stronghold because of the enemy.

name: Nahum 3:12
text: All your fortresses will be like fig trees with the first-ripe figs: if they are shaken, they fall into the mouth of the eater.

name: Nahum 3:13
text: Behold, your troops in your midst are women. The gates of your land are set wide open to your enemies. The fire has devoured your bars.

name: Nahum 3:14
text: Draw water for the siege. Strengthen your fortresses. Go into the clay, and tread the mortar. Make the brick kiln strong.

name: Nahum 3:15
text: There the fire will devour you. The sword will cut you off. It will devour you like the grasshopper. Multiply like grasshoppers. Multiply like the locust.

name: Nahum 3:16
text: You have increased your merchants more than the stars of the skies. The grasshopper strips, and flees away.

name: Nahum 3:17
text: Your guards are like the locusts, and your officials like the swarms of locusts, which settle on the walls on a cold day, but when the sun appears, they flee away, and their place is not known where they are.

name: Nahum 3:18
text: Your shepherds slumber, king of Assyria. Your nobles lie down. Your people are scattered on the mountains, and there is no one to gather them.

name: Nahum 3:19
text: There is no healing your wound, for your injury is fatal. All who hear the report of you clap their hands over you; for who hasn"t felt your endless cruelty?

name: Habakkuk 1:1
text: The oracle which Habakkuk the prophet saw.

name: Habakkuk 1:2
text: Yahweh, how long will I cry, and you will not hear? I cry out to you "Violence!" and will you not save?

name: Habakkuk 1:3
text: Why do you show me iniquity, and look at perversity? For destruction and violence are before me. There is strife, and contention rises up.

name: Habakkuk 1:4
text: Therefore the law is paralyzed, and justice never goes forth; for the wicked surround the righteous; therefore justice goes forth perverted.

name: Habakkuk 1:5
text: "Look among the nations, watch, and wonder marvelously; for I am working a work in your days, which you will not believe though it is told you.

name: Habakkuk 1:6
text: For, behold, I raise up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, that march through the breadth of the earth, to possess dwelling places that are not theirs.

name: Habakkuk 1:7
text: They are feared and dreaded. Their judgment and their dignity proceed from themselves.

name: Habakkuk 1:8
text: Their horses also are swifter than leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves. Their horsemen press proudly on. Yes, their horsemen come from afar. They fly as an eagle that hurries to devour.

name: Habakkuk 1:9
text: All of them come for violence. Their hordes face the desert. He gathers prisoners like sand.

name: Habakkuk 1:10
text: Yes, he scoffs at kings, and princes are a derision to him. He laughs at every stronghold, for he builds up an earthen ramp, and takes it.

name: Habakkuk 1:11
text: Then he sweeps by like the wind, and goes on. He is indeed guilty, whose strength is his god."

name: Habakkuk 1:12
text: Aren"t you from everlasting, Yahweh my God, my Holy One? We will not die. Yahweh, you have appointed him for judgment. You, Rock, have established him to punish.

name: Habakkuk 1:13
text: You who have purer eyes than to see evil, and who cannot look on perversity, why do you tolerate those who deal treacherously, and keep silent when the wicked swallows up the man who is more righteous than he,

name: Habakkuk 1:14
text: and make men like the fish of the sea, like the creeping things, that have no ruler over them?

name: Habakkuk 1:15
text: He takes up all of them with the hook. He catches them in his net, and gathers them in his dragnet. Therefore he rejoices and is glad.

name: Habakkuk 1:16
text: Therefore he sacrifices to his net, and burns incense to his dragnet, because by them his life is luxurious, and his food is good.

name: Habakkuk 1:17
text: Will he therefore continually empty his net, and kill the nations without mercy?

name: Habakkuk 2:1
text: I will stand at my watch, and set myself on the ramparts, and will look out to see what he will say to me, and what I will answer concerning my complaint.

name: Habakkuk 2:2
text: Yahweh answered me, "Write the vision, and make it plain on tablets, that he who runs may read it.

name: Habakkuk 2:3
text: For the vision is yet for the appointed time, and it hurries toward the end, and won"t prove false. Though it takes time, wait for it; because it will surely come. It won"t delay.

name: Habakkuk 2:4
text: Behold, his soul is puffed up. It is not upright in him, but the righteous will live by his faith.

name: Habakkuk 2:5
text: Yes, moreover, wine is treacherous. A haughty man who doesn"t stay at home, who enlarges his desire as Sheol, and he is like death, and can"t be satisfied, but gathers to himself all nations, and heaps to himself all peoples.

name: Habakkuk 2:6
text: Won"t all these take up a parable against him, and a taunting proverb against him, and say, "Woe to him who increases that which is not his, and who enriches himself by extortion! How long?"

name: Habakkuk 2:7
text: Won"t your debtors rise up suddenly, and wake up those who make you tremble, and you will be their victim?

name: Habakkuk 2:8
text: Because you have plundered many nations, all the remnant of the peoples will plunder you, because of men"s blood, and for the violence done to the land, to the city and to all who dwell in it.

name: Habakkuk 2:9
text: Woe to him who gets an evil gain for his house, that he may set his nest on high, that he may be delivered from the hand of evil!

name: Habakkuk 2:10
text: You have devised shame to your house, by cutting off many peoples, and have sinned against your soul.

name: Habakkuk 2:11
text: For the stone will cry out of the wall, and the beam out of the woodwork will answer it.

name: Habakkuk 2:12
text: Woe to him who builds a town with blood, and establishes a city by iniquity!

name: Habakkuk 2:13
text: Behold, isn"t it of Yahweh of Armies that the peoples labor for the fire, and the nations weary themselves for vanity?

name: Habakkuk 2:14
text: For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of Yahweh, as the waters cover the sea.

name: Habakkuk 2:15
text: "Woe to him who gives his neighbor drink, pouring your inflaming wine until they are drunk, so that you may gaze at their naked bodies!

name: Habakkuk 2:16
text: You are filled with shame, and not glory. You will also drink, and be exposed! The cup of Yahweh"s right hand will come around to you, and disgrace will cover your glory.

name: Habakkuk 2:17
text: For the violence done to Lebanon will overwhelm you, and the destruction of the animals, which made them afraid; because of men"s blood, and for the violence done to the land, to every city and to those who dwell in them.

name: Habakkuk 2:18
text: "What value does the engraved image have, that its maker has engraved it; the molten image, even the teacher of lies, that he who fashions its form trusts in it, to make mute idols?

name: Habakkuk 2:19
text: Woe to him who says to the wood, "Awake!" or to the mute stone, "Arise!" Shall this teach? Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver, and there is no breath at all in its midst.

name: Habakkuk 2:20
text: But Yahweh is in his holy temple. Let all the earth be silent before him!"

name: Habakkuk 3:1
text: A prayer of Habakkuk, the prophet, set to victorious music.

name: Habakkuk 3:2
text: Yahweh, I have heard of your fame. I stand in awe of your deeds, Yahweh. Renew your work in the midst of the years. In the midst of the years make it known. In wrath, you remember mercy.

name: Habakkuk 3:3
text: God came from Teman, the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the heavens, and his praise filled the earth.

name: Habakkuk 3:4
text: His splendor is like the sunrise. Rays shine from his hand, where his power is hidden.

name: Habakkuk 3:5
text: Plague went before him, and pestilence followed his feet.

name: Habakkuk 3:6
text: He stood, and shook the earth. He looked, and made the nations tremble. The ancient mountains were crumbled. The age-old hills collapsed. His ways are eternal.

name: Habakkuk 3:7
text: I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction. The dwellings of the land of Midian trembled.

name: Habakkuk 3:8
text: Was Yahweh displeased with the rivers? Was your anger against the rivers, or your wrath against the sea, that you rode on your horses, on your chariots of salvation?

name: Habakkuk 3:9
text: You uncovered your bow. You called for your sworn arrows. Selah. You split the earth with rivers.

name: Habakkuk 3:10
text: The mountains saw you, and were afraid. The storm of waters passed by. The deep roared and lifted up its hands on high.

name: Habakkuk 3:11
text: The sun and moon stood still in the sky, at the light of your arrows as they went, at the shining of your glittering spear.

name: Habakkuk 3:12
text: You marched through the land in wrath. You threshed the nations in anger.

name: Habakkuk 3:13
text: You went forth for the salvation of your people, for the salvation of your anointed. You crushed the head of the land of wickedness. You stripped them head to foot. Selah.

name: Habakkuk 3:14
text: You pierced the heads of his warriors with their own spears. They came as a whirlwind to scatter me, gloating as if to devour the wretched in secret.

name: Habakkuk 3:15
text: You trampled the sea with your horses, churning mighty waters.

name: Habakkuk 3:16
text: I heard, and my body trembled. My lips quivered at the voice. Rottenness enters into my bones, and I tremble in my place, because I must wait quietly for the day of trouble, for the coming up of the people who invade us.

name: Habakkuk 3:17
text: For though the fig tree doesn"t flourish, nor fruit be in the vines; the labor of the olive fails, the fields yield no food; the flocks are cut off from the fold, and there is no herd in the stalls:

name: Habakkuk 3:18
text: yet I will rejoice in Yahweh. I will be joyful in the God of my salvation!

name: Habakkuk 3:19
text: Yahweh, the Lord, is my strength. He makes my feet like deer"s feet, and enables me to go in high places. For the music director, on my stringed instruments.

name: Zephaniah 1:1
text: The word of Yahweh which came to Zephaniah, the son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of Hezekiah, in the days of Josiah, the son of Amon, king of Judah.

name: Zephaniah 1:2
text: I will utterly sweep away everything off of the surface of the earth, says Yahweh.

name: Zephaniah 1:3
text: I will sweep away man and animal. I will sweep away the birds of the sky, the fish of the sea, and the heaps of rubble with the wicked. I will cut off man from the surface of the earth, says Yahweh.

name: Zephaniah 1:4
text: I will stretch out my hand against Judah, and against all the inhabitants of Jerusalem. I will cut off the remnant of Baal from this place: the name of the idolatrous and pagan priests,

name: Zephaniah 1:5
text: those who worship the army of the sky on the housetops, those who worship and swear by Yahweh and also swear by Malcam,

name: Zephaniah 1:6
text: those who have turned back from following Yahweh, and those who haven"t sought Yahweh nor inquired after him.

name: Zephaniah 1:7
text: Be silent at the presence of the Lord Yahweh, for the day of Yahweh is at hand. For Yahweh has prepared a sacrifice. He has consecrated his guests.

name: Zephaniah 1:8
text: It will happen in the day of Yahweh"s sacrifice, that I will punish the princes, the king"s sons, and all those who are clothed with foreign clothing.

name: Zephaniah 1:9
text: In that day, I will punish all those who leap over the threshold, who fill their master"s house with violence and deceit.

name: Zephaniah 1:10
text: In that day, says Yahweh, there will be the noise of a cry from the fish gate, a wailing from the second quarter, and a great crashing from the hills.

name: Zephaniah 1:11
text: Wail, you inhabitants of Maktesh, for all the people of Canaan are undone! All those who were loaded with silver are cut off.

name: Zephaniah 1:12
text: It will happen at that time, that I will search Jerusalem with lamps, and I will punish the men who are settled on their dregs, who say in their heart, "Yahweh will not do good, neither will he do evil."

name: Zephaniah 1:13
text: Their wealth will become a spoil, and their houses a desolation. Yes, they will build houses, but won"t inhabit them. They will plant vineyards, but won"t drink their wine.

name: Zephaniah 1:14
text: The great day of Yahweh is near. It is near, and hurries greatly, the voice of the day of Yahweh. The mighty man cries there bitterly.

name: Zephaniah 1:15
text: That day is a day of wrath, a day of distress and anguish, a day of trouble and ruin, a day of darkness and gloom, a day of clouds and blackness,

name: Zephaniah 1:16
text: a day of the trumpet and alarm, against the fortified cities, and against the high battlements.

name: Zephaniah 1:17
text: I will bring distress on men, that they will walk like blind men, because they have sinned against Yahweh, and their blood will be poured out like dust, and their flesh like dung.

name: Zephaniah 1:18
text: Neither their silver nor their gold will be able to deliver them in the day of Yahweh"s wrath, but the whole land will be devoured by the fire of his jealousy; for he will make an end, yes, a terrible end, of all those who dwell in the land.

name: Zephaniah 2:1
text: Gather yourselves together, yes, gather together, you nation that has no shame,

name: Zephaniah 2:2
text: before the appointed time when the day passes as the chaff, before the fierce anger of Yahweh comes on you, before the day of Yahweh"s anger comes on you.

name: Zephaniah 2:3
text: Seek Yahweh, all you humble of the land, who have kept his ordinances. Seek righteousness. Seek humility. It may be that you will be hidden in the day of Yahweh"s anger.

name: Zephaniah 2:4
text: For Gaza will be forsaken, and Ashkelon a desolation. They will drive out Ashdod at noonday, and Ekron will be rooted up.

name: Zephaniah 2:5
text: Woe to the inhabitants of the sea coast, the nation of the Cherethites! The word of Yahweh is against you, Canaan, the land of the Philistines. I will destroy you, that there will be no inhabitant.

name: Zephaniah 2:6
text: The sea coast will be pastures, with cottages for shepherds and folds for flocks.

name: Zephaniah 2:7
text: The coast will be for the remnant of the house of Judah. They will find pasture. In the houses of Ashkelon, they will lie down in the evening, for Yahweh, their God, will visit them, and restore them.

name: Zephaniah 2:8
text: I have heard the reproach of Moab, and the insults of the children of Ammon, with which they have reproached my people, and magnified themselves against their border.

name: Zephaniah 2:9
text: Therefore as I live, says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, surely Moab will be as Sodom, and the children of Ammon as Gomorrah, a possession of nettles, and salt pits, and a perpetual desolation. The remnant of my people will plunder them, and the survivors of my nation will inherit them.

name: Zephaniah 2:10
text: This they will have for their pride, because they have reproached and magnified themselves against the people of Yahweh of Armies.

name: Zephaniah 2:11
text: Yahweh will be awesome to them, for he will famish all the gods of the land. Men will worship him, everyone from his place, even all the shores of the nations.

name: Zephaniah 2:12
text: You Cushites also, you will be killed by my sword.

name: Zephaniah 2:13
text: He will stretch out his hand against the north, destroy Assyria, and will make Nineveh a desolation, as dry as the wilderness.

name: Zephaniah 2:14
text: Herds will lie down in the midst of her, all the animals of the nations. Both the pelican and the porcupine will lodge in its capitals. Their calls will echo through the windows. Desolation will be in the thresholds, for he has laid bare the cedar beams.

name: Zephaniah 2:15
text: This is the joyous city that lived carelessly, that said in her heart, "I am, and there is none besides me." How she has become a desolation, a place for animals to lie down in! Everyone who passes by her will hiss, and shake their fists.

name: Zephaniah 3:1
text: Woe to her who is rebellious and polluted, the oppressing city!

name: Zephaniah 3:2
text: She didn"t obey the voice. She didn"t receive correction. She didn"t trust in Yahweh. She didn"t draw near to her God.

name: Zephaniah 3:3
text: Her princes in the midst of her are roaring lions. Her judges are evening wolves. They leave nothing until the next day.

name: Zephaniah 3:4
text: Her prophets are arrogant and treacherous people. Her priests have profaned the sanctuary. They have done violence to the law.

name: Zephaniah 3:5
text: Yahweh, in the midst of her, is righteous. He will do no wrong. Every morning he brings his justice to light. He doesn"t fail, but the unjust know no shame.

name: Zephaniah 3:6
text: I have cut off nations. Their battlements are desolate. I have made their streets waste, so that no one passes by. Their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, so that there is no inhabitant.

name: Zephaniah 3:7
text: I said, "Just fear me. Receive correction, so that her dwelling won"t be cut off, according to all that I have appointed concerning her." But they rose early and corrupted all their doings.

name: Zephaniah 3:8
text: "Therefore wait for me," says Yahweh, "until the day that I rise up to the prey, for my determination is to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour on them my indignation, even all my fierce anger, for all the earth will be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.

name: Zephaniah 3:9
text: For then I will purify the lips of the peoples, that they may all call on the name of Yahweh, to serve him shoulder to shoulder.

name: Zephaniah 3:10
text: From beyond the rivers of Cush, my worshipers, even the daughter of my dispersed people, will bring my offering.

name: Zephaniah 3:11
text: In that day you will not be disappointed for all your doings, in which you have transgressed against me; for then I will take away out of the midst of you your proudly exulting ones, and you will no more be haughty in my holy mountain.

name: Zephaniah 3:12
text: But I will leave in the midst of you an afflicted and poor people, and they will take refuge in the name of Yahweh.

name: Zephaniah 3:13
text: The remnant of Israel will not do iniquity, nor speak lies, neither will a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth, for they will feed and lie down, and no one will make them afraid."

name: Zephaniah 3:14
text: Sing, daughter of Zion! Shout, Israel! Be glad and rejoice with all your heart, daughter of Jerusalem.

name: Zephaniah 3:15
text: Yahweh has taken away your judgments. He has thrown out your enemy. The King of Israel, Yahweh, is in the midst of you. You will not be afraid of evil any more.

name: Zephaniah 3:16
text: In that day, it will be said to Jerusalem, "Don"t be afraid, Zion. Don"t let your hands be weak."

name: Zephaniah 3:17
text: Yahweh, your God, is in the midst of you, a mighty one who will save. He will rejoice over you with joy. He will calm you in his love. He will rejoice over you with singing.

name: Zephaniah 3:18
text: I will remove those who grieve about the appointed feasts from you. They are a burden and a reproach to you.

name: Zephaniah 3:19
text: Behold, at that time I will deal with all those who afflict you, and I will save those who are lame, and gather those who were driven away. I will give them praise and honor, whose shame has been in all the earth.

name: Zephaniah 3:20
text: At that time will I bring you in, and at that time will I gather you; for I will give you honor and praise among all the peoples of the earth, when I restore your fortunes before your eyes, says Yahweh.

name: Haggai 1:1
text: In the second year of Darius the king, in the sixth month, in the first day of the month, the Word of Yahweh came by Haggai, the prophet, to Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua, the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, saying,

name: Haggai 1:2
text: "This is what Yahweh of Armies says: These people say, "The time hasn"t yet come, the time for Yahweh"s house to be built.""

name: Haggai 1:3
text: Then the Word of Yahweh came by Haggai, the prophet, saying,

name: Haggai 1:4
text: "Is it a time for you yourselves to dwell in your paneled houses, while this house lies waste?

name: Haggai 1:5
text: Now therefore this is what Yahweh of Armies says: Consider your ways.

name: Haggai 1:6
text: You have sown much, and bring in little. You eat, but you don"t have enough. You drink, but you aren"t filled with drink. You clothe yourselves, but no one is warm, and he who earns wages earns wages to put them into a bag with holes in it."

name: Haggai 1:7
text: This is what Yahweh of Armies says: "Consider your ways.

name: Haggai 1:8
text: Go up to the mountain, bring wood, and build the house. I will take pleasure in it, and I will be glorified," says Yahweh.

name: Haggai 1:9
text: "You looked for much, and, behold, it came to little; and when you brought it home, I blew it away. Why?" says Yahweh of Armies, "Because of my house that lies waste, while each of you is busy with his own house.

name: Haggai 1:10
text: Therefore for your sake the heavens withhold the dew, and the earth withholds its fruit.

name: Haggai 1:11
text: I called for a drought on the land, on the mountains, on the grain, on the new wine, on the oil, on that which the ground brings forth, on men, on livestock, and on all the labor of the hands."

name: Haggai 1:12
text: Then Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, and Joshua, the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, with all the remnant of the people, obeyed the voice of Yahweh, their God, and the words of Haggai, the prophet, as Yahweh, their God, had sent him; and the people feared Yahweh.

name: Haggai 1:13
text: Then Haggai, Yahweh"s messenger, spoke Yahweh"s message to the people, saying, "I am with you," says Yahweh.

name: Haggai 1:14
text: Yahweh stirred up the spirit of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and the spirit of Joshua, the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and the spirit of all the remnant of the people; and they came and worked on the house of Yahweh of Armies, their God,

name: Haggai 1:15
text: in the twenty-fourth day of the month, in the sixth month, in the second year of Darius the king.

name: Haggai 2:1
text: In the seventh month, in the twenty-first day of the month, the Word of Yahweh came by Haggai the prophet, saying,

name: Haggai 2:2
text: "Speak now to Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua, the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and to the remnant of the people, saying,

name: Haggai 2:3
text: "Who is left among you who saw this house in its former glory? How do you see it now? Isn"t it in your eyes as nothing?

name: Haggai 2:4
text: Yet now be strong, Zerubbabel," says Yahweh. "Be strong, Joshua, son of Jehozadak, the high priest. Be strong, all you people of the land," says Yahweh, "and work, for I am with you," says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Haggai 2:5
text: This is the word that I covenanted with you when you came out of Egypt, and my Spirit lived among you. "Don"t be afraid."

name: Haggai 2:6
text: For this is what Yahweh of Armies says: "Yet once, it is a little while, and I will shake the heavens, the earth, the sea, and the dry land;

name: Haggai 2:7
text: and I will shake all nations. The precious things of all nations will come, and I will fill this house with glory, says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Haggai 2:8
text: The silver is mine, and the gold is mine," says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Haggai 2:9
text: "The latter glory of this house will be greater than the former," says Yahweh of Armies; "and in this place will I give peace," says Yahweh of Armies."

name: Haggai 2:10
text: In the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, the Word of Yahweh came by Haggai the prophet, saying,

name: Haggai 2:11
text: "Thus says Yahweh of Armies: Ask now the priests concerning the law, saying,

name: Haggai 2:12
text: "If someone carries holy meat in the fold of his garment, and with his fold touches bread, stew, wine, oil, or any food, will it become holy?"" The priests answered, "No."

name: Haggai 2:13
text: Then Haggai said, "If one who is unclean by reason of a dead body touch any of these, will it be unclean?" The priests answered, "It will be unclean."

name: Haggai 2:14
text: Then Haggai answered, ""So is this people, and so is this nation before me," says Yahweh; "and so is every work of their hands. That which they offer there is unclean.

name: Haggai 2:15
text: Now, please consider from this day and backward, before a stone was laid on a stone in the temple of Yahweh.

name: Haggai 2:16
text: Through all that time, when one came to a heap of twenty measures, there were only ten. When one came to the wine vat to draw out fifty, there were only twenty.

name: Haggai 2:17
text: I struck you with blight, mildew, and hail in all the work of your hands; yet you didn"t turn to me," says Yahweh.

name: Haggai 2:18
text: "Consider, please, from this day and backward, from the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, since the day that the foundation of Yahweh"s temple was laid, consider it.

name: Haggai 2:19
text: Is the seed yet in the barn? Yes, the vine, the fig tree, the pomegranate, and the olive tree haven"t brought forth. From this day will I bless you.""

name: Haggai 2:20
text: The Word of Yahweh came the second time to Haggai in the twenty-fourth day of the month, saying,

name: Haggai 2:21
text: "Speak to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, saying, "I will shake the heavens and the earth.

name: Haggai 2:22
text: I will overthrow the throne of kingdoms. I will destroy the strength of the kingdoms of the nations. I will overthrow the chariots, and those who ride in them. The horses and their riders will come down, everyone by the sword of his brother.

name: Haggai 2:23
text: In that day, says Yahweh of Armies, will I take you, Zerubbabel, my servant, the son of Shealtiel," says Yahweh, "and will make you as a signet, for I have chosen you," says Yahweh of Armies."

name: Zechariah 1:1
text: In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of Yahweh came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying,

name: Zechariah 1:2
text: "Yahweh was very displeased with your fathers.

name: Zechariah 1:3
text: Therefore tell them: Thus says Yahweh of Armies: "Return to me," says Yahweh of Armies, "and I will return to you," says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Zechariah 1:4
text: Don"t you be like your fathers, to whom the former prophets proclaimed, saying: Thus says Yahweh of Armies, "Return now from your evil ways, and from your evil doings;" but they did not hear, nor listen to me, says Yahweh.

name: Zechariah 1:5
text: Your fathers, where are they? And the prophets, do they live forever?

name: Zechariah 1:6
text: But my words and my decrees, which I commanded my servants the prophets, didn"t they overtake your fathers? "Then they repented and said, "Just as Yahweh of Armies determined to do to us, according to our ways, and according to our practices, so he has dealt with us.""

name: Zechariah 1:7
text: On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, which is the month Shebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of Yahweh came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying,

name: Zechariah 1:8
text: "I had a vision in the night, and behold, a man riding on a red horse, and he stood among the myrtle trees that were in a ravine; and behind him there were red, brown, and white horses.

name: Zechariah 1:9
text: Then I asked, "My lord, what are these?"" The angel who talked with me said to me, "I will show you what these are."

name: Zechariah 1:10
text: The man who stood among the myrtle trees answered, "They are the ones Yahweh has sent to go back and forth through the earth."

name: Zechariah 1:11
text: They reported to the angel of Yahweh who stood among the myrtle trees, and said, "We have walked back and forth through the earth, and behold, all the earth is at rest and in peace."

name: Zechariah 1:12
text: Then the angel of Yahweh replied, "O Yahweh of Armies, how long will you not have mercy on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, against which you have had indignation these seventy years?"

name: Zechariah 1:13
text: Yahweh answered the angel who talked with me with kind and comforting words.

name: Zechariah 1:14
text: So the angel who talked with me said to me, "Proclaim, saying, "Thus says Yahweh of Armies: "I am jealous for Jerusalem and for Zion with a great jealousy.

name: Zechariah 1:15
text: I am very angry with the nations that are at ease; for I was but a little displeased, but they added to the calamity."

name: Zechariah 1:16
text: Therefore thus says Yahweh: "I have returned to Jerusalem with mercy. My house shall be built in it," says Yahweh of Armies, "and a line shall be stretched forth over Jerusalem.""

name: Zechariah 1:17
text: "Proclaim further, saying, "Thus says Yahweh of Armies: "My cities will again overflow with prosperity, and Yahweh will again comfort Zion, and will again choose Jerusalem."""

name: Zechariah 1:18
text: I lifted up my eyes, and saw, and behold, four horns.

name: Zechariah 1:19
text: I asked the angel who talked with me, "What are these?" He answered me, "These are the horns which have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem."

name: Zechariah 1:20
text: Yahweh showed me four craftsmen.

name: Zechariah 1:21
text: Then I asked, "What are these coming to do?" He said, "These are the horns which scattered Judah, so that no man lifted up his head; but these have come to terrify them, to cast down the horns of the nations, which lifted up their horn against the land of Judah to scatter it."

name: Zechariah 2:1
text: I lifted up my eyes, and saw, and behold, a man with a measuring line in his hand.

name: Zechariah 2:2
text: Then I asked, "Where are you going?" He said to me, "To measure Jerusalem, to see what is its breadth and what is its length."

name: Zechariah 2:3
text: Behold, the angel who talked with me went forth, and another angel went out to meet him,

name: Zechariah 2:4
text: and said to him, "Run, speak to this young man, saying, "Jerusalem will be inhabited as villages without walls, because of the multitude of men and livestock in it.

name: Zechariah 2:5
text: For I," says Yahweh, "will be to her a wall of fire around it, and I will be the glory in the midst of her.

name: Zechariah 2:6
text: Come! Come! Flee from the land of the north," says Yahweh; "for I have spread you abroad as the four winds of the sky," says Yahweh.

name: Zechariah 2:7
text: "Come, Zion! Escape, you who dwell with the daughter of Babylon."

name: Zechariah 2:8
text: For thus says Yahweh of Armies: "For honor he has sent me to the nations which plundered you; for he who touches you touches the apple of his eye.

name: Zechariah 2:9
text: For, behold, I will shake my hand over them, and they will be a spoil to those who served them; and you will know that Yahweh of Armies has sent me.

name: Zechariah 2:10
text: Sing and rejoice, daughter of Zion; for, behold, I come, and I will dwell in the midst of you," says Yahweh.

name: Zechariah 2:11
text: Many nations shall join themselves to Yahweh in that day, and shall be my people; and I will dwell in the midst of you, and you shall know that Yahweh of Armies has sent me to you.

name: Zechariah 2:12
text: Yahweh will inherit Judah as his portion in the holy land, and will again choose Jerusalem.

name: Zechariah 2:13
text: Be silent, all flesh, before Yahweh; for he has roused himself from his holy habitation!"

name: Zechariah 3:1
text: He showed me Joshua the high priest standing before the angel of Yahweh, and Satan standing at his right hand to be his adversary.

name: Zechariah 3:2
text: Yahweh said to Satan, "Yahweh rebuke you, Satan! Yes, Yahweh who has chosen Jerusalem rebuke you! Isn"t this a burning stick plucked out of the fire?"

name: Zechariah 3:3
text: Now Joshua was clothed with filthy garments, and was standing before the angel.

name: Zechariah 3:4
text: He answered and spoke to those who stood before him, saying, "Take the filthy garments off of him." To him he said, "Behold, I have caused your iniquity to pass from you, and I will clothe you with rich clothing."

name: Zechariah 3:5
text: I said, "Let them set a clean turban on his head." So they set a clean turban on his head, and clothed him; and the angel of Yahweh was standing by.

name: Zechariah 3:6
text: The angel of Yahweh protested to Joshua, saying,

name: Zechariah 3:7
text: "Thus says Yahweh of Armies: "If you will walk in my ways, and if you will follow my instructions, then you also shall judge my house, and shall also keep my courts, and I will give you a place of access among these who stand by.

name: Zechariah 3:8
text: Hear now, Joshua the high priest, you and your fellows who sit before you; for they are men who are a sign: for, behold, I will bring forth my servant, the Branch.

name: Zechariah 3:9
text: For, behold, the stone that I have set before Joshua; on one stone are seven eyes: behold, I will engrave its engraving," says Yahweh of Armies, "and I will remove the iniquity of that land in one day.

name: Zechariah 3:10
text: In that day," says Yahweh of Armies, "you will invite every man his neighbor under the vine and under the fig tree.""

name: Zechariah 4:1
text: The angel who talked with me came again, and wakened me, as a man who is wakened out of his sleep.

name: Zechariah 4:2
text: He said to me, "What do you see?" I said, "I have seen, and behold, a lampstand all of gold, with its bowl on the top of it, and its seven lamps thereon; there are seven pipes to each of the lamps, which are on the top of it;

name: Zechariah 4:3
text: and two olive trees by it, one on the right side of the bowl, and the other on the left side of it."

name: Zechariah 4:4
text: I answered and spoke to the angel who talked with me, saying, "What are these, my lord?"

name: Zechariah 4:5
text: Then the angel who talked with me answered me, "Don"t you know what these are?" I said, "No, my lord."

name: Zechariah 4:6
text: Then he answered and spoke to me, saying, "This is the word of Yahweh to Zerubbabel, saying, "Not by might, nor by power, but by my Spirit," says Yahweh of Armies.

name: Zechariah 4:7
text: Who are you, great mountain? Before Zerubbabel you are a plain; and he will bring out the capstone with shouts of "Grace, grace, to it!""

name: Zechariah 4:8
text: Moreover the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

name: Zechariah 4:9
text: "The hands of Zerubbabel have laid the foundation of this house. His hands shall also finish it; and you will know that Yahweh of Armies has sent me to you.

name: Zechariah 4:10
text: Indeed, who despises the day of small things? For these seven shall rejoice, and shall see the plumb line in the hand of Zerubbabel. These are the eyes of Yahweh, which run back and forth through the whole earth."

name: Zechariah 4:11
text: Then I asked him, "What are these two olive trees on the right side of the lampstand and on the left side of it?"

name: Zechariah 4:12
text: I asked him the second time, "What are these two olive branches, which are beside the two golden spouts, that pour the golden oil out of themselves?"

name: Zechariah 4:13
text: He answered me, "Don"t you know what these are?" I said, "No, my lord."

name: Zechariah 4:14
text: Then he said, "These are the two anointed ones who stand by the Lord of the whole earth."

name: Zechariah 5:1
text: Then again I lifted up my eyes, and saw, and behold, a flying scroll.

name: Zechariah 5:2
text: He said to me, "What do you see?" I answered, "I see a flying scroll; its length is twenty cubits, and its breadth ten cubits."

name: Zechariah 5:3
text: Then he said to me, "This is the curse that goes out over the surface of the whole land; for everyone who steals shall be cut off according to it on the one side; and everyone who swears falsely shall be cut off according to it on the other side.

name: Zechariah 5:4
text: I will cause it to go out," says Yahweh of Armies, "and it will enter into the house of the thief, and into the house of him who swears falsely by my name; and it will remain in the midst of his house, and will destroy it with its timber and its stones."

name: Zechariah 5:5
text: Then the angel who talked with me came forward, and said to me, "Lift up now your eyes, and see what is this that is appearing."

name: Zechariah 5:6
text: I said, "What is it?" He said, "This is the ephah basket that is appearing." He said moreover, "This is their appearance in all the land

name: Zechariah 5:7
text: (and behold, a talent of lead was lifted up); and this is a woman sitting in the midst of the ephah basket."

name: Zechariah 5:8
text: He said, "This is Wickedness;" and he threw her down into the midst of the ephah basket; and he threw the weight of lead on its mouth.

name: Zechariah 5:9
text: Then lifted I up my eyes, and saw, and behold, there were two women, and the wind was in their wings. Now they had wings like the wings of a stork, and they lifted up the ephah basket between earth and the sky.

name: Zechariah 5:10
text: Then I said to the angel who talked with me, "Where are these carrying the ephah basket?"

name: Zechariah 5:11
text: He said to me, "To build her a house in the land of Shinar. When it is prepared, she will be set there in her own place."

name: Zechariah 6:1
text: Again I lifted up my eyes, and saw, and behold, four chariots came out from between two mountains; and the mountains were mountains of brass.

name: Zechariah 6:2
text: In the first chariot were red horses; in the second chariot black horses;

name: Zechariah 6:3
text: in the third chariot white horses; and in the fourth chariot dappled horses, all of them powerful.

name: Zechariah 6:4
text: Then I asked the angel who talked with me, "What are these, my lord?"

name: Zechariah 6:5
text: The angel answered me, "These are the four winds of the sky, which go forth from standing before the Lord of all the earth.

name: Zechariah 6:6
text: The one with the black horses goes out toward the north country; and the white went out after them; and the dappled went forth toward the south country."

name: Zechariah 6:7
text: The strong went out, and sought to go that they might walk back and forth through the earth: and he said, "Go around and through the earth!" So they walked back and forth through the earth.

name: Zechariah 6:8
text: Then he called to me, and spoke to me, saying, "Behold, those who go toward the north country have quieted my spirit in the north country."

name: Zechariah 6:9
text: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

name: Zechariah 6:10
text: "Take of them of the captivity, even of Heldai, of Tobijah, and of Jedaiah; and come the same day, and go into the house of Josiah the son of Zephaniah, where they have come from Babylon.

name: Zechariah 6:11
text: Yes, take silver and gold, and make crowns, and set them on the head of Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest;

name: Zechariah 6:12
text: and speak to him, saying, "Thus says Yahweh of Armies, "Behold, the man whose name is the Branch: and he shall grow up out of his place; and he shall build the temple of Yahweh;

name: Zechariah 6:13
text: even he shall build the temple of Yahweh; and he shall bear the glory, and shall sit and rule on his throne; and he shall be a priest on his throne; and the counsel of peace shall be between them both.

name: Zechariah 6:14
text: The crowns shall be to Helem, and to Tobijah, and to Jedaiah, and to Hen the son of Zephaniah, for a memorial in the temple of Yahweh.

name: Zechariah 6:15
text: Those who are far off shall come and build in the temple of Yahweh; and you shall know that Yahweh of Armies has sent me to you. This will happen, if you will diligently obey the voice of Yahweh your God."""

name: Zechariah 7:1
text: It happened in the fourth year of king Darius that the word of Yahweh came to Zechariah in the fourth day of the ninth month, the month of Chislev.

name: Zechariah 7:2
text: The people of Bethel sent Sharezer and Regem Melech, and their men, to entreat Yahweh"s favor,

name: Zechariah 7:3
text: and to speak to the priests of the house of Yahweh of Armies, and to the prophets, saying, "Should I weep in the fifth month, separating myself, as I have done these so many years?"

name: Zechariah 7:4
text: Then the word of Yahweh of Armies came to me, saying,

name: Zechariah 7:5
text: "Speak to all the people of the land, and to the priests, saying, "When you fasted and mourned in the fifth and in the seventh month for these seventy years, did you at all fast to me, really to me?

name: Zechariah 7:6
text: When you eat, and when you drink, don"t you eat for yourselves, and drink for yourselves?

name: Zechariah 7:7
text: Aren"t these the words which Yahweh proclaimed by the former prophets, when Jerusalem was inhabited and in prosperity, and its cities around her, and the South and the lowland were inhabited?""

name: Zechariah 7:8
text: The word of Yahweh came to Zechariah, saying,

name: Zechariah 7:9
text: "Thus has Yahweh of Armies spoken, saying, "Execute true judgment, and show kindness and compassion every man to his brother.
